floor.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the flat surface that you stand on inside a building
floor.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: a puddle of water on the kitchen floor
a warehouse that has 410,000 square feet of floor space
floor.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: the part of a car that forms its inside floor
floor.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: one of the levels in a building
floor.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Our office is on the top floor.
We are located on the seventh floor of the building.
floor.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: the ground at the bottom of the ocean, the forest etc
floor.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: creatures that live on the ocean floor
floor.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: an area in a room where people can dance
floor.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: There were two or three couples already on the dance floor.
Everyone took to the floor for the last waltz.
floor.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: a large area in a building where a lot of people do their jobs
floor.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: He wasn’t keen on the idea of working on the shop floor (=the part of a factory where people make things using machines).
the busy trading floor (=area where stocks and shares are bought and sold)
floor.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: an officially agreed limit below which something cannot go
floor.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: Manufacturers have tried to put a floor under the price of their products.
floor.translation[0].note_box[0].section: Next he had to clean the floor.
He grabbed a broom and began sweeping the floor.
I washed and waxed the kitchen floor.
Officers found her lying face down on the floor.
He let his cigarette fall to the floor.
I’ve still got to clean the bathroom floor.
The hut had a muddy wooden floor.
He strode across the marble floor.
There were a couple of oriental rugs on the tiled floor.
Barbara was sitting on the carpeted floor.
Father Murphy led me to a tiny room with a bare floor and a simple bed.
When you buy floor tiles, always get a few extra.
The room smelt of floor polish.
A carpet fitter can fit floor coverings quickly and inexpensively.
The shop has 33,000 square feet of floor space.
floor.translation[0].note_box[1].section: one of the levels in a building
She lives in an apartment on the eighteenth floor.
used when saying how many levels a building has
The school is a single storey building.
the floor of a building that is at ground level
There is a shop on the ground floor.
The emergency room is on the first floor.
the floor of a building above the one at ground level
She lives on the first floor.
one of the levels on a ship, bus, or plane
The Horizon Lounge is on the top deck of the ship.
floor.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to surprise or shock someone so much that they do not know what to say or do
floor.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: A couple of the questions completely floored me.
floor.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to hit someone so hard that they fall down
floor.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: He was floored in the first round of the fight.
floor.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to make a car go as fast as possible
floor.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: I got into the car and floored it.
floor.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: the lowest EXCHANGE RATE a currency is permitted to fall to
floor.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: Traders were buying Argentine pesos at prices well belowthe currency’s floor against the dollar.
floor.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: a level below which prices, wages etc are not allowed to fall
floor.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: The agreement might also act as a floor to wages during the recession.
Quarterlyprice floors were established for Japanese commodities.
floor.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: the part of a financial market where shares, COMMODITIES (=oils, metals, farm products) etc are bought and sold. In American English, only trading floor and exchange floor are used, not dealing floor
floor.translation[2].definitions[2].exam: He eventually took responsibility for running the dealing floor.
Any business done by a member ‘under the rules’ is treated as exchange business, even where this takes place away from the exchange floor.
floor.translation[2].definitions[3].defi: a dealing, trading, or exchange floor
floor.translation[2].definitions[4].defi: the place where a public meeting or discussion happens, or the people who attend it
floor.translation[2].definitions[4].exam: At the meeting, the administration were recommended by the floor to reconsider the deal they had earlier rejected.
floor.translation[2].definitions[5].defi: if you get in on the ground floor, you get involved in a business activity when it begins
floor.translation[2].definitions[5].exam: The scope for an entrepreneur to get in on the ground floor and turn petrol stations into shops was obvious to those with an eye for business.
floor.translation[2].definitions[6].defi: used to refer to the workers who make the goods in a factory
floor.translation[2].definitions[6].exam: the union’s influence on the factory floor
He’d moved up from shop floor worker to production manager.
floor.translation[2].definitions[7].defi: the area in a factory where the ordinary workers do their work
floor.translation[2].definitions[7].exam: The chairwoman started her working life on the shop floor.
